short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Keep groups of similar tabs together.

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
A Chrome extension that automatically rearranges tabs based on a set of regular expressions provided by the user. This mimics, in a way, the "pin" behavior built into Chrome since tabs that match a given expression are moved as far to the left as possible and grouped together.

The extension attempts, within reason, to maintain its arrangements.

An example usage, and the reason I built it, would be to keep the tabs for a bunch of pull requests that you are involved in grouped together and easy to find at a glance.
